paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: 3 males, 7 females; ages 30-70; predominantly African American

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with cardiac amyloidosis, presenting with heart failure symptoms
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with cardiac amyloidosis at age 34.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with cardiac amyloidosis, presenting with arrhythmias
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P2 was diagnosed with cardiac amyloidosis at age 57.

individual_records.phenotype_details: no symptoms, monitored for potential development of disease
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P3 remains asymptomatic at age 62.

functional_data.summary: The TTR V142I variant is associated with altered protein stability and aggregation.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The TTR variant is a known founder mutation in certain populations.
key_quotes: TTR V142I is a founder variant present in 3-4% of African Americans.
The identification of TTR variants can lead to targeted management strategies.

tables_processed.table_caption: Common diseases in which a positive genetic test result is associated with changes to clinical management options for the patient

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the TTR gene was extracted successfully.
